hero.title: Our Mother <1/> Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church
hero.subtitle: Learn the teachings of the Church and serve with devotion.

events.title: Church Festivals
events.subtitle: Major feast days and celebrations of the Church.

1.title: Enkutatash (Ethiopian New Year)
1.desc: Enkutatash (Ethiopian New Year) is celebrated on Meskerem 1 (September 11/12), marking the end of the rainy season and the beginning of the harvest season. The name 'Enkutatash' is said to mean 'gift of jewels' or 'flower for the new year,' referring to the tradition of giving flowers (especially the Adey Abeba) during this time. The Ethiopian New Year is a time of joy, hope, and renewal, with families gathering to celebrate with traditional foods and festivities.

2.title: Meskel
2.desc: Commemoration of the discovery of the True Cross.

3.title: Genna
3.desc: Celebration of the birth of our Lord Jesus Christ.

4.title: Timket
4.desc: Celebration of the baptism of our Lord in the Jordan River.

community.title: Community of the Faithful
community.body: Within the Orthodox Church community, faith, love, and service live together. Believers draw near to God through prayer, sacred tradition, and praise, and they connect with one another in love. The community is a place of spiritual growth, serving those in need, spreading peace, and living the Gospel in daily life. Here, people strengthen their faith and come to God together.

hero.title: Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church
hero.subtitle: A faith rooted in apostolic tradition, history, and spiritual life passed through generations.

ethiopia.title: Orthodoxy in Ethiopia
paragraphs: Christianity reached Ethiopia in the early centuries through apostolic tradition. The Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church became a pillar of faith, culture, and national identity.
For centuries, the Church preserved scripture, tradition, and spiritual life, shaping Ethiopian history and civilization.

community.title: Global Orthodox Community
community.subtitle: Discover the nations where Orthodox Christianity has the strongest presence today.

ethiopia.name: Ethiopia
ethiopia.description: Ethiopia is one of the oldest Christian nations in the world, with a continuous Orthodox tradition dating back to the 4th century.

russia.name: Russia
russia.description: Russia has the largest Orthodox population in Europe, deeply influencing its culture, history, and national identity.

greece.name: Greece
greece.description: Greece is historically central to Orthodox theology and tradition, with a strong national Orthodox identity.

romania.name: Romania
romania.description: Romania maintains one of the highest percentages of Orthodox Christians in Europe.

serbia.name: Serbia
serbia.description: The Serbian Orthodox Church plays a central role in Serbian national and cultural identity.

bulgaria.name: Bulgaria
bulgaria.description: Orthodoxy has shaped Bulgarian history and spiritual life for over a millennium.

egypt.name: Egypt
egypt.description: Egypt is home to the Coptic Orthodox Church, one of the oldest Christian communities in the world.

ukraine.name: Ukraine
ukraine.description: Ukraine has a strong Orthodox heritage rooted in the baptism of Kyivan Rus.

georgia.name: Georgia
georgia.description: Georgia is one of the earliest Christian kingdoms with a deeply rooted Orthodox identity.

mary-of-zion.name: Church of St. Mary of Zion
mary-of-zion.significance: One of the most sacred churches in Ethiopian Orthodoxy, traditionally believed to house the Ark of the Covenant.

holy-sepulchre.name: Church of the Holy Sepulchre
holy-sepulchre.significance: Built on the site of Jesus Christ’s crucifixion, burial, and resurrection.

hagia-sophia.name: Hagia Sophia
hagia-sophia.significance: For centuries, Hagia Sophia was the heart of Eastern Orthodox Christianity.

saint-sava.name: Temple of Saint Sava
saint-sava.significance: One of the largest Orthodox churches in the world and a symbol of Serbian Orthodoxy.

alexander-nevsky.name: Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
alexander-nevsky.significance: A monumental cathedral built in honor of Saint Alexander Nevsky.

trinity-lavra.name: Trinity Lavra of St. Sergius
trinity-lavra.significance: The spiritual center of the Russian Orthodox Church.

famous.title: Famous Figures of Orthodoxy
famous.subtitle: Saints and theologians who shaped Orthodox faith, worship, and tradition across centuries.

1.name: St. Athanasius
1.title: Defender of the Trinity
1.description: A central figure in Orthodox theology, known for defending the divinity of Christ against Arianism.

2.name: St. Cyril of Alexandria
2.title: Pillar of Orthodoxy
2.description: A powerful theologian who played a decisive role in defining Orthodox Christology.

3.name: St. Yared
3.title: Father of Ethiopian Church Music
3.description: Composer of the sacred Ethiopian Orthodox chants still sung today.

4.name: St. Tekle Haymanot
4.title: Monk & Miracle Worker
4.description: A revered Ethiopian saint known for ascetic life and spiritual discipline.

brand.title: Orthodox Church
brand.tagline: A place of faith, hope, love, and spiritual growth.

about.title: About Kidase
about.body: Kidase is a central liturgy of worship. This page organizes the materials by language for easier access and study.
